intro: Daucus guttatus f. concolor, commonly known as the smooth cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its flowers are white or pale pink, with a distinctive, finely divided leaf structure. The subspecies concolor is distinguished by its smooth, non-hairy stems and leaves compared to the typical form.
